question: [Governance] A cooperative in Gwagwalada (FCT) suspects stock pilferage. What builds trust fastest?

options.A: Publish stock/receipt logs; rotate leadership; independent audits

question: [Aquaculture] At 5 a.m. after a hot, still night in Bwari (FCT), catfish gasp at the surface. Immediate stabilizing action?

options.A: Start aeration; reduce feeding; check DO/pH/ammonia

question: [Quarantine] A truck with seed potatoes lacks a phytosanitary certificate at Illela. What should officials do?

options.A: Hold consignment for NAQS inspection and require proper documentation

question: [Cold Chain] A tomato aggregator delays cooling until arrival in town. What should they do instead?

options.A: Pre‑cool soon after harvest to remove field heat

question: [Conflict Mitigation] Mapped transhumance corridor crosses cropland in Zuba (FCT). What reduces clashes?

options.A: Negotiate corridor/watering schedules; share contacts; monitor

question: [Security] A farmer group in Kwali (FCT) reports footprints and cut fencing near their grain store at 9 p.m. What is the BEST immediate action?

options.A: Trigger the community alert protocol and call security contacts
options.B: Confront suspects alone in the dark
options.C: Post GPS location and threats online

question: [Border/SPS] At Jibiya, officers find frozen poultry lacking SPS papers. What compliant step best protects biosecurity?

options.A: Seize and dispose per SPS rules; document and notify NAQS/NCS
options.D: Escort to market to avoid spoilage

question: [Food Safety] A dairy collector in Bwari (FCT) has raw milk at 30°C two hours after milking. What preserves safety/quality?

options.A: Rapidly chill to ~4°C and maintain cold chain

question: [IPM] A maize plot shows FAW ‘shot‑holes’ on 10% of plants. What should the extension agent advise first?

options.A: Scout and confirm thresholds; then apply targeted control
options.D: Ignore; FAW disappears on its own
